snippet: A ruling finds valid reasons to curtail the religious rights of Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, the Army psychiatrist charged in a deadly rampage in 2009.
abstract: Col Gregory Gross, military judge presiding over the trial of Fort Hood shooting suspect Maj Nidal Malik Hasan, orders officials to forcibly shave Hasan; move is likely to delay the start of his trial for weeks as defense lawyers appeal ruling; judge held hearing to determine whether forcibly shaving Hasan violates his religious liberties under federal law, but prosecutors argue that the beard is intended to prevent witnesses from identifying Hasan at trial.
lead_paragraph: A ruling finds valid reasons to curtail the religious rights of Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, the Army psychiatrist charged in a deadly rampage in 2009.

headline.seo: Fort Hood Suspect’s Beard Must Be Shaved, Judge Rules
